findings.title: High-severity issue involving owner address influence
findings.description: An attacker would only need to compromise an owner's private key to withdraw funds at a significant discount.

findings.title: Low-severity issues related to copy-pasted third-party dependencies
findings.description: Copy-pasting third-party dependencies can introduce security risks and inconsistencies.

findings.title: Liquidity Providers unintentionally burning tokens while withdrawing funds from the pool by allowing tokens to be sent to `address(0)`
findings.description: Liquidity Providers may unintentionally burn tokens while withdrawing funds from the pool due to allowing tokens to be sent to `address(0)`

findings.title: Loss of Precision Due to Integer Division
findings.description: The contracts included use of safe arithmetic functions but identified one scenario where loss of precision due to integer division may result in tokens being sold for free.

findings.title: Undetermined-severity issues relating to Solidity compiler optimizations and `ABIEncoderV2` usage
findings.description: Potential unexpected side effects due to non-default enabling of Solidity compiler optimizations and `ABIEncoderV2` usage, which may lead to unforeseen consequences.

findings.title: Functions that don't adhere to the `checks-effects-interactions` pattern
findings.description: The functions do not follow the checks-effects-interactions pattern which may lead to re-entrancy issues if other safeguards are removed in the future.

findings.title: Ineffective conditional checks on largely fluctuating gas prices
findings.description: The contract contains ineffective conditional checks related to highly volatile gas prices.

findings.title: Ensuring all state-changing functions emit events
findings.description: Ensuring all state-changing functions emit events to help users and third-party apps stay up to date with the blockchain state.
